arm_group.arm_group_label: group 3: RT and CT, and/or hyperthermia
arm_group.description: treatment=  radiotherapy combined with chemotherapy and/or hyperthermia
cervical cancer stage IV b, treatment =  any systemic or radiation therapy and supportive care

brief_summary.textblock:
The main aim is to validate and improve the predictive model for survival and toxicity in
      patients with cervical cancer through multicentric prospective data collection. The data
      contain information on patient, tumor and treatment characteristics. For this study,
      additional health related QOL scores will be assessed using the EORTC Quality of Life
      Questionair-CX24 and C30. The long term aim, beyond this specific study, is to build a
      Decision Support System based on the predictive model validated in this study.

clinical_study.brief_title: Predicting Outcome in Cervix Carcinoma: a Prospective Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  histological or cytological proven cervical cancer

          -  informed consent according to national rules

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  no histological or cytological proven cervical cancer

          -  no informed consent according to national rules

study_pop.textblock: All patients with cervical cancer can be included in the study.

clinical_study.official_title: Predicting Outcome in Cervix Carcinoma: a Prospective Study

overall_official.affiliation: Maas tricht University hospital, dep of radiotherapy (Maastro clinic)

oversight_info.authority: Netherlands: The Central Committee on Research Involving Human Subjects (CCMO)

primary_outcome.description: assessment  of the overall survival 5 years after treatment

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

secondary_outcome.description: assessment of distant disease free survival, 3 years after treatment
assessment of local disease free survival, 3 year after treatment
assessment of distant disease free survival,5 years after treatment
assessment of local disease free survival, 5 years after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: number of participants with early adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability
number of participants with late adverse events as a measure of safety and tolerability
